boat.full_description:
The original hull form was taken from an actual boat built at Devoran on the River Fal for an Oyster dredger. Developed by Cygnus Boats as a fishing/rowing/lug rigged boat she was adopted by the Hamble River Rowing club and christened The Bursledon Gig.

They compete successfully in the close confines of the Hamble River with 20 odd boats plus a growing rowing fleet in Langstone  and elsewhere. 'De Ernest John C' has a Lug ketch rig using a Carbon pole and 'hand cut' sails. Lee way is interesting with no c/b or plate.

De Ernest John C was named in honour of the owners father.
boat.name: D Ernest John C
boat.short_description: Bursledon Gig Rowing Lugger ketch. used  by the Hamble River Rowing Club and benefitting from a Lug Ketch Rig for enhanced use & fun.
